subject: Law
title: Impeachment: Checking the President
description: A quick win: understand Impeachment: Checking the President.

hook.text: Only three US presidents have been impeached. None were removed by the Senate. The process matters anyway.

buildup.text: The House impeaches (charges) by simple majority. The Senate tries and convicts with a two-thirds vote.

discovery.text: The Constitution lists 'high Crimes and Misdemeanors' as groundsâ€”a phrase left deliberately vague.

twist.text: Gerald Ford said it means 'whatever a majority of the House considers it to be.' Politics always plays a role.

climax.text: Impeachment is a political process with legal trappings, not a criminal trial. Removal requires political will.

punchline.text: Impeachment is the ultimate checkâ€”rarely used, always significant.
